sentences: Tokichi Setoguchi (瀬戸口藤吉, Setoguchi Tōkichi, 28 June 1868 – 8 November 1941) was a Japanese composer, music educator, conductor and clarinetist.
section: N/A
== Biography ==

sentences: Biography ==
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Setoguchi was born on 28 June 1868, in Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan, in what is now the city of Tarumizu.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 1882, Setoguchi enlisted as a clarinetist in the military band of the Imperial Japanese Navy in Yokosuka.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Later, he became an orchestra conductor.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: During a concert tour in 1907 through 16 European countries, he enjoyed great success, and became known as the Japanese Sousa.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 1910 he accompanied Prince Yoshihito on his journey to London for the coronation celebrations of King George V of the United Kingdom.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: He retired in 1917.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: After his active service he was a professor of music at various universities and music conservatories.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: He died in Azabu, (near Tokyo) on 8 November 1941 of a cerebral hemorrhage.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: As a composer he wrote a number of songs and military marches.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In addition, he reformed Japanese military music between World War I and World War II.
section: == Biography ==
